titlestmt.titleproper: Hugh Barbour papers regarding the New York Yearly Meeting tercentenary 1968-1995 1991-1995

did.unittitle: Hugh Barbour papers regarding the New York Yearly Meeting tercentenary
did.repository: Swarthmore College, Friends Historical Library Swarthmore, Pennsylvania 19081-1399 U.S.A.

bioghist.p: Hugh Barbour was Professor of Religion at Earlham College and Earlham School of Religion from 1953 to 1991. He is the author of The Quakers in Puritan England (1964) and co-editor of Early Quaker Writings, 1650-1700 (1973), among many other works. He is a member of Cambridge Meeting. Barbour's book Quaker Crosscurrents: Three Hundred Years of Friends in the New York Yearly Meetings was published by Syracuse University Press in 1995. The book was a joint project undertaken by Hugh Barbour, Christopher Densmore, Arthur J. Worrall, Elizabeth Moger, and other contributors to provide a history of the New York Yearly Meeting on the occasion of its tercentenary.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of papers of Hugh Barbour related to his book Quaker Crosscurrents. Materials include typed and annotated drafts of chapters, and research materials, including articles, newsletters, correspondence, and handwritten notes. The collection also includes course syllabi for Barbour's courses on religion at Earlham from 1968 to 1990.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Friends Historical Library, Swarthmore College: Hugh Barbour lecture papers (SC/008); Earlham College: Hugh Barbour Collection. 1953-1991 (FMS 103).
